title: Ran space
summary: In mathematics, the Ran space (or Ran's space) of a topological space X is a topological space Ran ‚Å° ( X ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {Ran} (X)} whose underlying set is the set of all nonempty finite subsets of X: for a metric space X the topology is induced by the Hausdorff distance. The notion is named after Ziv Ran.
